intro: Impatiens sacculata, commonly known as the "whispering bells" or "bells of Ireland," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and prefers moist, well-drained soil in partial shade. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Impatiens sacculata is often cultivated for its beauty and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
